item.title: How to calm your mind with breathing, according to science - The Washington Post
item.description:
How to Calm Your Mind with Breathing, According to Science

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 at 7:00 a.m. EST Source: The Washington Post

This article explores the science behind breathing techniques and their effectiveness in reducing stress and enhancing mood. Through conscious breathing, individuals can experience immediate benefits for their mental state.

  • Breathwork practices are beneficial for alleviating stress.
  • Slowing one's breath can lead to improved mood.
  • Research highlights the connection between breathing and emotional regulation.
  • Conscious breathing influences thoughts, feelings, and behavior.
“If you feel even a bit calmer, you have just experienced the power of conscious and intentional breathing.”

In conclusion, integrating breathwork into daily routines can significantly improve mental well-being and emotional stability.

item.title: December GST collections rise 7.3% YoY to Rs 1.77 lakh crore - Moneycontrol
item.description:
December GST collections rise 7.3% YoY to Rs 1.77 lakh crore

Date: January 01, 2025 Source: Moneycontrol

Goods and Services Tax collections rose to Rs 1.77 lakh crore in December, maintaining a level above Rs 1.7 lakh crore for the tenth consecutive month.

  • GST collections increased by 7.3% compared to Rs 1.65 lakh crore in December 2023.
  • Collections were below the Rs 2.1 lakh crore mark reached in April of the previous year.
  • The growth rate of 7.3% is the slowest pace observed in three months.
“India's recent GST collections have slowed down slightly, which is typical after the holiday season. It’s well in line with expectations as we have been witnessing slight decrease in consumer spending over past few months,” said Saurabh Agarwal, Tax Partner, EY India.

Overall, the data suggests a need for monitoring consumer spending trends in the upcoming months to understand potential impacts on future GST collections.

item.title: After Ingenuity's success, Nasa introduces a new 'Mars Chopper' design - Business Standard
item.description:
NASA Unveils New 'Mars Chopper' Design Following Ingenuity's Success

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: NASA News

Nasa has introduced a new helicopter design, the Mars Chopper, which is set to enhance Mars exploration after the success of its predecessor, Ingenuity.

  • The Mars Chopper is larger and equipped with six rotors, each with six smaller blades to increase lift.
  • It has a payload capacity of 5 kg, enabling it to carry scientific instruments for detailed terrain studies.
  • The helicopter demonstrates capabilities to reach distances of up to three kilometers.
  • It aims to assist in exploring areas that are inaccessible to rovers.
  • Ingenuity performed 72 flights over three years, far exceeding its initial mission requirements.
“Scientists could use Chopper to study large swaths of terrain in detail, quickly – including areas where rovers cannot safely travel.” - NASA

The Mars Chopper's advanced design is expected to significantly contribute to future missions, providing vital aerial data for both robotic and potential human explorations.

item.title: Breakaway Moldovan region cuts heat and hot water as Russian gas flow ends - Reuters.com
item.description:
Transdniestria Cuts Heating and Hot Water Amidst Russian Gas Supply Halt

Date: Jan 1, 2023 | Source: Reuters

The breakaway Moldovan region of Transdniestria has halted heating and hot water supplies due to the cessation of Russian gas flow, affecting approximately 450,000 residents. Families are advised to gather and keep warm in single rooms as they adjust to the cold.

  • Immediate impact felt from halting of Russian gas supply
  • Breakaway Transdniestria relied on gas pumped via Ukraine
  • Russian-speaking area split from Moldova in the 1990s
  • Families told to cover windows and huddle in one room
"We prepared two rooms for this emergency and installed electric fireplaces... so we will hold on like this, hoping that this whole situation with gas is temporary."

The Moldovan government is implementing measures to reduce energy consumption, with state officials noting improvements in energy load management.

item.title: Two killed in Russian drone strike on Kyiv - Reuters
item.description:
Russian Drone Strike on Kyiv Claims Two Lives

Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: Reuters

Russia launched a drone strike on Kyiv on New Year's Day, resulting in two deaths and at least six injuries. Buildings were damaged in two districts, highlighting ongoing hostilities amid the nearly three-year-long invasion of Ukraine.

  • Two individuals were killed and at least six wounded in the strike.
  • Explosions were reported as air defenses engaged incoming drones.
  • Significant damage occurred in central Kyiv with portions of a residential building destroyed.
  • President Zelenskiy condemned the attack, noting Russia's ongoing aggression against Ukraine.
  • Kyiv's military reported downing 63 of 111 drones launched during the overnight assault.
"Even on New Year's Eve, Russia was only concerned about how to hurt Ukraine." - President Volodymyr Zelenskiy

This attack represents the continued pattern of Russian assaults on Ukrainian cities, further escalating the conflict as the New Year begins.

item.title: Mouni Roy trips and falls on pavement after celebrating New Year with Disha Patani; husband Suraj Nambiar picks her up - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mouni Roy trips and falls on pavement after celebrating New Year with Disha Patani; husband Suraj Nambiar picks her up

Date: Jan 01, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Mouni Roy took a tumble while exiting a New Year's Party in Mumbai, accompanied by her husband Suraj Nambiar and friend Disha Patani. Surrounded by paparazzi, Mouni lost her balance and fell on the pavement, but Suraj quickly helped her up.

  • Mouni was seen falling while leaving a New Year's party with Suraj and Disha.
  • Suraj held her hand to help her get up as the paparazzi clicked pictures.
  • Fans expressed concern for Mouni and criticized the paparazzi's invasiveness.
  • Mouni and Disha have been friends since participating in The Entertainers Tour together.
  • Mouni's recent work includes a series on Disney+ Hotstar and an upcoming film scheduled for 2025.
“Hope she is okay.”

In conclusion, Mouni's fall highlights the challenges celebrities face with paparazzi attention, but also shows the support of friends and family during unexpected situations.

item.title: Russia ceases gas transit through Ukraine after over 30 years - The Times of India
item.description:
Russia Ceases Gas Transit Through Ukraine After Over 30 Years

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: [Insert Source Here]

This article discusses the significant event of Russia halting gas transit through Ukraine, which marks the end of over three decades of a vital energy supply route.

  • The cessation of gas transit affects European energy supplies.
  • Ukraine has relied on transit fees from Russia's gas exports for economic stability.
  • The decision may escalate tensions between Russia and Ukraine.
“This is a pivotal moment for European energy independence,” said an energy analyst.

The conclusion underscores the potential long-term implications for energy politics in Europe and security concerns.

item.title: Stargazers, assemble! List of astronomical events to grace our skies in 2025- Check details here - The Financial Express
item.description:
Astounding Celestial Events to Look Forward to in 2025

Published: 2024-12-31, Source: Unknown (Based on Space.com reports)

The year 2025 promises an exciting lineup of astronomical events, sure to captivate stargazers worldwide.

  • Quadrantid meteor shower in January, visible from the West Coast of America, with up to 120 meteors per hour.
  • Moon moving in front of Pleiades Star Cluster on January 9, and again in February and July, best viewed through small telescopes or binoculars.
  • Venus's bright appearance in January and February, shifting to the morning sky by April.
  • Total lunar eclipse on March 13-14, visible across the Americas.
  • Saturn's ring disappearance from March 23 to May 6.
  • Partial solar eclipse on March 29, visible in parts of Africa, Greenland, and Europe.
  • Perseid meteor shower in the summer of August, accompanied by a close conjunction of Venus and Jupiter.

Article concludes with a list of remarkable celestial events happening in 2025, offering stargazers a wealth of astronomical spectacles to enjoy.

item.title: Russia and Ukraine end five decades of gas transit to Europe - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Russia and Ukraine End Gas Transit to Europe After 50 Years

Date: January 01, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Russia has halted gas shipments to Europe via Ukraine as a key transit deal expired. The stoppage puts pressure on central European countries dependent on this supply to find costlier alternatives.

  • Russia stopped gas transit to Europe through Ukraine after five decades.
  • This decision follows Ukraine's refusal to extend a key transit agreement.
  • Countries reliant on these supplies must seek more expensive gas alternatives.
  • The gas supply crisis is exacerbated by rapidly depleting winter storage.
  • Gas prices have surged over 50% year-on-year due to market tensions.
“We cite a lack of technical and legal opportunities for shipments amid repeated and explicit refusal of the Ukrainian side to extend these agreements.” - Gazprom PJSC

The cessation of gas supplies marks a significant shift in European energy dynamics, especially as the region grapples with ongoing supply issues.

item.title: Kannada star Shiva Rajkumar is now cancer-free after surgery in US, shares emotional message: 'I'll be back stronger' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Shiva Rajkumar Declares Victory Over Cancer in Emotional New Year Message

Publication Date: Jan 01, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In a heartfelt New Year message, actor and film producer Shiva Rajkumar shared his immense gratitude after successfully battling cancer following surgery in the US.

  • Shiva Rajkumar underwent bladder cancer surgery in December 2024 at the Miami Cancer Institute.
  • He expressed fear prior to diagnosis but attributed his strength to the support of family, friends, and fans.
  • Rajkumar detailed his experience, acknowledging the challenges of chemotherapy and expressing gratitude for his medical team.
  • His wife, Geetha, confirmed the positive outcome of his treatment, stating he is officially cancer-free.
  • The actor expressed optimism about his recovery and plans to take care of himself moving forward.
  • The news of his recovery has significantly uplifted his fans, who had been praying for his health.
"I am eternally grateful for all your love and blessings. Happy New Year! #2025." - Shiva Rajkumar

This inspiring announcement has brought hope and joy not only to his fans but also to many who have faced similar health battles.

item.title: Cabinet approves Rs 69,515 crore outlay to extend crop insurance schemes; PM Modi says govt's first decis - The Times of India
item.description:
Cabinet Approves Rs 69,515 Crore for Extended Crop Insurance; PM Modi's New Year Dedication to Farmers

Date & Source: January 1, 2023, Times of India

The Union Cabinet, chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, has approved a Rs 69,515 crore outlay to extend the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) and Restructured Weather Based Crop Insurance Scheme (RWBCIS) for the next five years. This is the government's first significant decision in the new year, dedicated to the welfare of farmers.

  • The extended schemes will benefit a larger number of farmers.
  • The decision aims to provide extensive coverage to crops and reduce premium rates.
"This decision is a testament to our commitment to doubling farmers' income and ensuring their welfare." - Prime Minister Narendra Modi

Conclusion: The cabinet's approval of Rs 69,515 crore for extended crop insurance schemes signals the government's continued support for farmers and their welfare.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir Not 1st Choice Coach, Only A 'Compromise': BCCI Official Drops Bomb - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir Not 1st Choice Coach, Only A 'Compromise': BCCI Official Drops Bomb

Publication Date: January 25, 2025
Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team is facing challenges regarding its leadership and performance, specifically under coach Gautam Gambhir. As tensions rise, clarity around team selection issues has become a concern.

  • Gambhir's capabilities as a coach have come under scrutiny amid poor performances from senior players.
  • Issues regarding communication and confidence among players have been highlighted following Gambhir's appointment.
  • The BCCI is reportedly discussing the future of Gambhir's coaching role, especially if performances do not improve.
"He was never BCCI's first choice (it was VVS Laxman) and some of the well-known overseas names didn't want to coach all three formats, so he was a compromise."

The BCCI is monitoring the team dynamics closely, especially in light of upcoming tournaments.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir's handling of Team India's transition raises eyebrows - The Times of India
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir's Coaching of Team India Under Scrutiny

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Times of India

The management of the Indian cricket team's transition by head coach Gautam Gambhir has raised concerns, particularly with the declining performances of key players Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. With the final Test match approaching, the atmosphere within the team appears tense.

  • Team struggling to find an effective mix against Australia in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Rohit Sharma's individual discussions with players about selection are reportedly insufficient.
  • Gambhir's outspoken nature has led to trust issues among players.
  • Concerns about Gambhir's relationship with the selection committee following recent team changes.
  • BCCI officials hint at potential instability in Gambhir’s coaching position if performance does not improve.
“If the performance doesn't improve, even Gautam Gambhir's position wouldn't be safe,” a senior BCCI official stated.

With upcoming tournaments like the Champions Trophy, Gambhir's future as head coach hinges on the team's performances.

item.title: Delhi Bakery Owner Dies By Suicide Amid Divorce Dispute, Family Says 'Wife Mentally Tortured Him' - News18
item.description:
Delhi Bakery Owner Dies By Suicide Amid Divorce Dispute, Family Says 'Wife Mentally Tortured Him'

Date & Source: January 01, 2025, 19:50 IST - News18

Puneet Khurana, owner of For God’s Cake bakery, allegedly died by suicide amid an ongoing divorce dispute with his wife. He was found hanging in his house in Model Town’s Kalyan Vihar area. His family claimed that Puneet was "upset with his wife" and had been facing mental torture and harassment from her and her family.

Key Points:

  1. The couple got married in 2016 and co-owned the bakery and another eatery called Woodbox Cafe.
  2. Puneet's last conversation was with his wife, discussing their bakery business. His family claims the wife recorded the conversation and sent it to her relatives.
  3. Puneet's sister accused his wife and her family of mental torture and harassment, with a 59-minute video recording as evidence.
  4. The case comes weeks after a similar incident involving a Bengaluru-based techie.

Notable Quote:

"You are calling me at 3 am, can’t you sleep? You disrespected me and my family." - Puneet Khurana's wife, as per India Today

Conclusion: The incident has once again highlighted the issue of mental harassment and torture within marriages, with calls for stricter laws and better support systems for victims.

item.title: One killed in Russian drone strike on Kyiv, officials say - Reuters
item.description:
One Killed in Russian Drone Strike on Kyiv

Date: January 1, 2025
Source: Reuters

Russia launched a drone strike on Kyiv early Wednesday, resulting in one death and multiple injuries.

  • One individual was killed and six others wounded in the drone strike.
  • The strike caused damage to buildings in two districts of Kyiv.
  • Kyiv Mayor Vitali Klitschko confirmed the destruction of two floors of a residential building.
  • President Volodymyr Zelenskiy condemned the attack, stating Russia aimed to harm Ukraine even during New Year's Eve.
  • Ukrainian air defenses were able to shoot down 63 of the 111 drones launched by Russia.
"Even on New Year's Eve, Russia was only concerned about how to hurt Ukraine." - President Volodymyr Zelenskiy

This event highlights the ongoing aggression of Russia against Ukraine, with significant implications for civilian safety and international relations.

item.title: Flipkart kicks off 2025 with ‘Big Bachat Days’ sale: Discounts on iPhone 16 series, Pixel 9, Galaxy Z Fold 6 and more | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Flipkart kicks off 2025 with ‘Big Bachat Days’ sale: Discounts on iPhone 16 series, Pixel 9, Galaxy Z Fold 6 and more

Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Walmart-owned Flipkart has kicked off its 'Big Bachat Days' sale, providing enticing discounts on a variety of smartphones from January 1 to January 5, 2025.

  • Discounts of up to ₹7,000 on Apple’s iPhone 16 series.
  • Google’s Pixel 9 series discounted by up to ₹10,000.
  • Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6 discounted by ₹12,500.
  • EMI plans of up to 24 months offered for HDFC Bank cardholders.
  • Sale includes offers on various brands like Motorola, Xiaomi, and Vivo.
“The iPhone 16 Pro Max (256GB) is available for ₹137,900, down from ₹144,900.”

In conclusion, Flipkart's 'Big Bachat Days' sale offers significant savings for smartphone buyers looking to upgrade their devices in early 2025.

item.title: Fitness expert shares four tips for those setting weight loss goals for the new year - The Times of India
item.description:
Fitness Expert's Four Tips for Effective Weight Loss in the New Year

Published on: January 1, 2025, Source: Times of India

As the new year begins, many people set weight loss goals. Fitness coach Lizzy High offers four effective and sustainable tips to help individuals achieve their weight loss objectives.

  • The 30-80-30 rule of diet: Quick, home-cooked meals, 80% whole foods, and 30 grams of protein per meal.
  • Daily movement: Incorporate physical activity, such as brisk walking, light stretching, or a quick workout, into your daily routine.
  • Mindset: Develop mental resilience, practice patience, and show self-compassion during the weight loss journey.
  • Small swaps: Make minor lifestyle changes, like cooking at home, prioritizing self-care, and managing stress, to enhance both physical and mental health.

Lizzy emphasizes the importance of consistency and a growth-oriented mindset in achieving long-term weight loss success.

item.title: Poco X7 5G series launch date confirmed: Key features and specifications revealed - India TV News
item.description:
Poco X7 5G Series Launch Date Confirmed: Key Features and Specifications Revealed

Publication Date: January 2025 Source: India TV News

The Poco X7 5G series is all set to launch in India on January 9, featuring the Poco X7 5G and Poco X7 Pro 5G models. The devices will be available on Flipkart, showcasing exciting design elements and robust specifications.

  • The Poco X7 5G includes a centrally located squircle-shaped rear camera and may be available in silver and green.
  • The Poco X7 Pro features a pill-shaped camera module and could sport a dual-tone black and green finish.
  • Performance is powered by MediaTek processors: Dimensity 8400-Ultra for the Pro and Dimensity 7300-Ultra for the standard model.
  • The Pro model is expected to have a 50MP primary camera, while the standard version may include a 20MP front camera for selfies.
  • Both phones are expected to have IP68 water and dust resistance ratings.
  • Display specifications include a 6.67-inch AMOLED with 120Hz refresh rate for both models, and battery capacities of 5,110mAh for the X7 and 6,000mAh for the Pro.
"The Poco X7 5G series is expected to make a big splash in the Indian market upon its release."

With a combination of compelling specifications and attractive design, the Poco X7 5G series aims to attract a significant audience upon its launch.
